value: Then Moses called all the people of Israel together and said to them:
“Listen, Israel, to the statutes and ordinances that I am about to deliver to you today; learn them and be careful to keep them!
YHWH
our God made a covenant with us at Horeb.
He
did not make this covenant with our ancestors
but with us, we who are here today, all of us living now.
YHWH
spoke face to face with you at the mountain, from the middle of the fire.
(I was standing between
YHWH
and you at that time to reveal to you the message
of
YHWH
, because you were afraid of the fire and would not go up the mountain.) He said:
“I am
YHWH
your God, he who brought you from the land of Egypt, from the place of slavery.
You must not have any other gods
besides me.
You must not make for yourself an image
of anything in heaven above, on earth below, or in the waters beneath.
You must not worship or serve them, for I,
YHWH
your God, am a jealous God. I punish
the sons, grandsons, and great-grandsons for the sin of the fathers who reject
me,
but I show covenant faithfulness
to the thousands
who choose
me and keep my commandments.
You must not make use of the name of
YHWH
your God for worthless purposes,
for
YHWH
will not exonerate anyone who abuses his name that way.
Be careful to observe
the Sabbath day just as
YHWH
your God has commanded you.
You are to work and do all your tasks in six days,
but the seventh day is the Sabbath
of
YHWH
your God. On that day you must not do any work, you, your son, your daughter, your male slave, your female slave, your ox, your donkey, any other animal, or the foreigner who lives with you,
so that your male and female slaves, like yourself, may have rest.
Recall that you were slaves in the land of Egypt and that
YHWH
your God brought you out of there by strength and power.
That is why
YHWH
your God has commanded you to observe
the Sabbath day.
Honor
your father and your mother just as
YHWH
your God has commanded you to do, so that your days may be extended and that it may go well with you in the land that he
is about to give you.
You must not murder.
You must not commit adultery.
You must not steal.
You must not offer false testimony against another.
You must not desire
another man’s
wife, nor should you crave his
house, his field, his male and female servants, his ox, his donkey, or anything else he owns.”
YHWH
said these things to your entire assembly at the mountain from the middle of the fire, the cloud, and the darkness with a loud voice, and that was all he said.
Then he inscribed the words
on two stone tablets and gave them to me.
Then, when you heard the voice from the midst of the darkness while the mountain was ablaze, all your tribal leaders and elders approached me.
You said, “
YHWH
our God has shown us his great glory
and we have heard him speak from the middle of the fire. It is now clear to us
that God can speak to human beings and they can keep on living.
But now, why should we die, because this intense fire will consume us! If we keep hearing the voice of
YHWH
our God we will die!
Who is there from the entire human race
who has heard the voice of the living God speaking from the middle of the fire as we have, and has lived?
You go near so that you can hear everything
YHWH
our God is saying and then you can tell us whatever he
says to you; then we will pay attention and do it.”
When
YHWH
heard you speaking to me, he
said to me, “I have heard what these people have said to you – they have spoken well.
If only it would really be their desire to fear me and obey
all my commandments in the future, so that it may go well with them and their descendants forever.
Go and tell them, ‘Return to your tents!’
But as for you, remain here with me so I can declare to you all the commandments,
statutes, and ordinances that you are to teach them, so that they can carry them out in the land I am about to give them.”
Be careful, therefore, to do exactly what
YHWH
your God has commanded you; do not turn right or left!
Walk just as he
has commanded you so that you may live, that it may go well with you, and that you may live long
in the land you are going to possess.
